Read the books years ago and finding this series was such a joy. Great to watch and unwind. Makes an enjoyable weekend mini- marathon with friends. Review Title: Love the books, enjoy the series! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/04/09 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Edward Hall', 'Peter Medak', 'Tom Shankland', 'Paul Unwin'], 'Producers': ['Rebecca Eaton (WGBH)', 'Phil Clymer (Chorion)', 'Michele Buck', 'Damien Timmer'], 'Starring': ['Geraldine McEwan', 'Anthony Andrews', 'Michael Brandon'], 'Studio': ['Acorn Media']} Review Text: Love the mysteries with the character Miss Marple. They make me smile. I like the fact they focus on the story and not a lot of blood and gore. Nice evening spent watching an engaging performance by Geraldine McEwan. Review Title: Spend the evening with a murder mystery Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Numb3rs Review Date: 2013/04/09 Categories: Suspense, Drama, Action Product Description: ['FBI agent Don Eppes recruits his mathematical genius brother Charlie to help the Bureau solve a wide range of challenging crimes in Los Angeles.'] Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dennis Smith', 'Alex Zakrzewski', 'John Behring', 'J. Miller Tobin', 'Stephen Gyllenhaal', 'Ralph Hemecker', 'Julie Hébert', 'Ken Sanzel', 'Rob Morrow', 'Rod Holcomb']} Review Text: Love the fact I can finally watch all the episodes I missed. I love the family relationship and how the characters interact together.
Smart little brother and the FBI older brother work well as a team to solve cases using math and science. Review Title: Love this series! Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Dollhouse Review Date: 2013/05/10 Categories: Science Fiction, Suspense, Drama, Action Product Description: ['In the highly anticipated first season of Dollhouse, Echo (Eliza Dushku) is an "Active," a member of a highly illegal and underground group who have had their personalities wiped clean so they can be imprinted with any number of new personas. Confined to a secret facility known as the "Dollhouse," Echo and the other Actives including Sierra and Victor carry out engagements assigned by Adelle, one of the Dollhouse leaders. The engagements cater to the wealthy, powerful and connected, and require the Actives to immerse themselves in all manner of scenarios - romantic, criminal, uplifting, dangerous, comical and the occasional "pro bono" good deed. After each scenario, Echo, always under the watchful eye of her handler Boyd, returns to the mysterious Dollhouse where her thoughts, feelings and experiences are erased by Topher, the Dollhouse\'s genius programmer. Echo enters the next scenario with no memory of before. Or does she?'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Solomon', 'Joss Whedon', 'Tim Minear', 'Félix Enríquez Alcalá', 'Dwight H. Little', 'David Straiton', 'John Cassaday', 'James A. Contner', 'Steven S. DeKnight', 'Jonathan Frakes']} Review Text: I was pleasantly surprised to find Dollhouse filled with action and mystery. The overall story line is continues from one episode to another and the twist and turns of the plots keep me coming back to learn more about the dollhouse. Review Title: Suspenseful and Mysterious. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/05/26 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Linfield'], 'Producers': ['Vanessa Berlowitz', 'Alastair Fothergill'], 'Starring': ['Sir David Attenborough'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} Review Text: Watch as a polar bear goes a-courting. Breath taking scenes, wildlife, what is not to like.
A great watch for exploring sights rarely seen by the lower 48 states. Great for educational
purposes without the dull narrative found in most educational videos. I love to relax and sip my hot cocoa, and take time for me just watching the snowy scenes pass before me. Review Title: Love it. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Templar Nation Review Date: 2013/10/22 Categories: Drama, Adventure Product Description: ["After an archaeologist and his students excavate a Templar Knight's tomb, they are thrown into the middle of an ancient blood feud. They must either follow the Templar's ancient path or face destruction at the hands of a dark league of assassin."] Average Rating: 2.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brian Vance'], 'Producers': ['Melissa Hays', 'Joseph James', 'Mark James', 'Rebecca James'], 'Starring': ['Erik Estrada', 'Richard Dutcher', 'Joseph James']} Review Text: I like the movie. It has a made for TV movie feel and sometimes the story is predictable. But I like a mystery and a bit of adventure so for me it was worth the watch. Review Title: It will do. It tells the story well and is full of action.
I think the new and old versions are worth a watch. Review Title: Interesting remake Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: TURN: Washington's Spies Review Date: 2014/04/18 Categories: Historical, Drama, Military and War Product Description: ["AMC's original series TURN: Washington's Spies is the untold story of America's first spy ring. An unlikely team of secret agents form The Culper Ring to help George Washington turn the tide of the Revolutionary War. Only on AMC."] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeremy Webb', 'Eagle Egilsson', 'Keith Boak', 'Andrew McCarthy', 'Nick Copus', 'Michael Uppendahl', 'Kate Dennis', 'Omar Madha', 'Ed Bianchi', 'S.J. Clarkson'], 'Producers': ['Craig Silverstein', 'Barry Josephson']} Review Text: this period in time is one of my favorites. The pilot episode is interesting while laying out the characters motives so to speak. Interesting character interactions. A bit of mystery and action as well helps to keep you wondering where things will lead. Review Title: Revolution? Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/12/07 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dan Bradley'], 'Producers': ['Beau Flynn'], 'Starring': ['Hemsworth', 'Chris (Jed Eckert)', 'Peck', 'Josh (Matt Eckert)', 'Hutcherson', 'Josh (Robert Kitner)']} Review Text: I like the newer version of this movie. It tells the story well and is full of action.
I think the new and old versions are worth a watch. Review Title: Interesting remake Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: TURN: Washington's Spies Review Date: 2014/04/18 Categories: Historical, Drama, Military and War Product Description: ["AMC's original series TURN: Washington's Spies is the untold story of America's first spy ring. An unlikely team of secret agents form The Culper Ring to help George Washington turn the tide of the Revolutionary War. Only on AMC."] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeremy Webb', 'Eagle Egilsson', 'Keith Boak', 'Andrew McCarthy', 'Nick Copus', 'Michael Uppendahl', 'Kate Dennis', 'Omar Madha', 'Ed Bianchi', 'S.J. Clarkson'], 'Producers': ['Craig Silverstein', 'Barry Josephson']} Review Text: this period in time is one of my favorites. The pilot episode is interesting while laying out the characters motives so to speak. Interesting character interactions. A bit of mystery and action as well helps to keep you wondering where things will lead. Review Title: Revolution? Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/12/18 Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Vidura Barrios', 'Jeffrey Main'], 'Producers': ['Vidura Barrios'], 'Studio': ['I Love Christmas']} Review Text: Beautiful images, with music who could ask for more? Nice addition to enhance the festivities this holiday season. Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/12/18 Average Rating: 1.6 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Geovanni Molina'], 'Producers': ['Geovanni Molina'], 'Starring': ['Geovanni Molina', 'Neil Orlikoff', 'Geretta Geretta'], 'Studio': ['EYE Film Releasing']} Review Text: Not what I was expecting, I could not sit through this movie. Review Title: One Star Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual's purchase history reveals a strong preference for mystery and suspense genres, particularly those characterized by engaging storylines, character depth, and limited graphic violence. A recurring enjoyment of Agatha Christie adaptations signifies an appreciation for classic narratives and lighter mysteries. The person shows a clear inclination towards intelligent narratives that incorporate elements of action and drama, as demonstrated through positive ratings for shows that feature complex character interactions, such as familial relationships in crime-solving contexts.

Quality is essential, with numerous high ratings (averaging above 4.5) across products, indicating a desire for well-produced content that balances entertainment with an intellectually stimulating plot. While generally lenient towards higher-priced items, there are hints of price sensitivity, particularly exhibited by one low rating (1.6) implying disappointment likely linked to perceived value versus cost in that instance.

The individual enjoys visually stunning content, as evidenced by their appreciation for documentaries featuring breathtaking wildlife scenery. This suggests a holistic preference for both narrative-driven and visually appealing media. Overall, the core preferences center around engaging, character-driven mysteries, quality production, visual richness, and a balance of entertainment value versus price sensitivity.

target_interaction.title: Love to walk!
target_interaction.text: Love this workout as I can use it rain or shine.  Great tips and very helpful.
target_interaction.title_meta: Leslie Sansone: Walk Away The Pounds: 30 Minute Walk
description: We'll begin with a gentle warm-up to get your body going.  Next, we increase the pace to be sure you are moving brickly enough to burn fat and condition the cardiovascular system.  Finally, we slowly decrease the walking pace to a cool-down and stretch to end the walk.  If your tracking miles, this workout is a two mile walk.
